item.title: Rubyconfindia 2018 : my first experience as a student scholar
item.description:
I recently started to learn ruby and I was really interested in the simplicity and powerfulness of this language. Well, I am not here to boast about the splendid features of ruby. So let move on to the Scholarship part.

Its during that time I heard about RubyConfIndia, the annual Ruby Conference. I googled about it and found that last time it was held in Kochi, the place where I was studying. And the most interesting thing I noticed was that it had a rich list of speakers and dignitaries that included the creator of ruby, Yukihiro Matsumoto, himself.

So I decided to give a try. I decided to apply for the Student Scholarship which covered the Conference ticket and travel costs. I applied with a small project in my github account which I did to learn Ruby on Rails previously. To be frank, I didn’t put much effort in filling up my Github account with ruby projects. I just applied because it was a cool one. Thats it. I didn’t even think about it after applying.

Jan 1, 2018

On this day, I got an email from Satish Talim Sir saying that I have been selected as a Student Scholar along with the conference ticket link.

Wow !! I couldn’t believe it. I read the mail again and again. I (kind of) had a goosebumps. I told my parents and friends. This may not be a big deal, but as it was my first, I had a reason to celebrate.

Feb 9, 2018 - Conference Day 1

I reached Bangalore the previous day and I had enough time to reach the venur on time. I registered and was super excited. I met many people and that was the best thing I did in that two days.

The conference had good keynotes from all speakers. And even though I couldn’t get everything from them I understood one thing, they were the best in their fields.

In between the breaks I met Avdi Grimm, Zach Holman, Elle Meredith and her cute lil baby, Harshankar, Aboobacker MK, Balashnkar C, Tony Vincent and many others. I also met with my fellow student scholars and other student scholars from Kerala. It was super good experience.

And like Harishankar quoted out “We are not going to learn any thing big in ruby in these two days, So Just go out and meet people”. I was super shy and it was Balashankar helped me out. Thanks Balu Chetta!

Feb 10, 2018 - Conference Day 2

The second day commenced and without much hickups everything went nice. One thing that stood out was the keynote given by Zach.

Zach Holman, he was the best and no wonder he is known for his talks and puns. I still remember and it was one of the best talks I’ve heard without getting bored. His slides were so cool and colorful.

The second and the final day ended and it was time to depart. It was the sad part. It was the best conference I’ve attended so far. I was happy that I got a community with whom I could talk ruby with a cup of tea.

item.title: Installing Visual Studio Code as Snap in Ubuntu
item.description:
Visual Studio Code , Microsoft's IDE , is now available on Ubuntu as a Snap. According to David Callé the Git integration comes very handy for the developers.

Here it comes with powerful built-in support for JS, Node.js and TypeScript. It also has rich environment support for other languages like C. C# ,PHP, GoLang etc.

Even though its not powerful as its predecessor Visual Studio, we can do very much in this VS Code. But you can customize it by installing plugins. It has wide variety of plugins.


Visual Studio Code in Ubuntu

Is it the only way to install VS Code ?

No. It was possible to install it using Ubuntu umake ( previously Ubuntu Developer Tools Center ) and like installing  usual .deb file. (The links for that are in the references section)
Its now possible to install ubuntu as a Snap.


What is the Big Deal?

Well the greatest advantage is that  by installing VS Code using snap you need not worry about updating the VS Code every time. To be more specific, the snaps autom
atically gets updated or refreshed with the latest snap. So you will be always having the latest VS Code running in your machine.

How To Install VS Code using Snap?



Installing VS Code using Snap


We can install it with simple command 

sudo snap install --classic vscode


P.S if you are installing snap packages for the first time please install snapd shown like below. This service runs in your machine and tracks the installed snaps in your machine.

sudo apt install snapd


Voila ! Your are ready to go.

item.title: Accessing Blocked Behance.net using Google's Public DNS
item.description:
Indian Telecommunication Department has blocked many websites for posting copyright issues. All those popular sites which has served for generations has been come under this ban.




But the interesting thing is that Behance has also been put under this Ban. For People who is new to this , its a social networking site for creative people who shares their work and other creative stuffs. Just like sharing Photos in Instagram, people share their creative arts and other stuffs over here. Its a community from which you can leverage maximum out of it.

Its strange that apart from having such a strong creative community over here. No one has raised their voice for this problem and even Adobe hasn't taken a note of it, i guess.
Whatever its hard when things changes like this.

However we'll see how to bypass those bans by Simply changing your current DNS settings.

Note: Please note down the current DNS settings which may come in handy if you want to revert back your settings

All you have to do is to change your TCP/IP Settings and point your DNS to Google's Public DNS

  • IPv4: 8.8.8.8 and/or 8.8.4.4
  • IPv6: 2001:4860:4860::8888 &/or 2001:4860:4860::8844
You can see full step by step procedure in Google's Developer page over Here.

P.S: This also removes restrictions for some other sites like torrent sites also.

item.title: [solved] Speaker and Earpieces not working in Sony Xperia z
item.description:
I had experienced an unusual problem/bug in my Sony Xperia Z. It was one of the craziest thing I had experienced.

The Bug was

  • Media Files Didn't have Audio Input
  • Earpieces got disabled/didnt work during phone calls. Each time I had to connect to an earpiece or put it in Loudspeaker to  continue with the phone calls.
  • The Videos Recorded didnt have an audio… etc

I was sure that it wasn’t a hardware issue because during diagnostics it all seemed working perfectly.


I sat browsing and posting about this bug for about 3 months ,but sadly I couldn’t find proper answers.

All of them pointed to few common solutions

  • Hard Reset
  • Uninstalling Recently Installed Apps
  • Rooting Your Phone .. etc

I had done the first two ,but couldnt do the latter one (As my phone’s Bootloader was Locked it was risky to do and it may even lead to Brick).


How I Solved it?

I installed few Apps. But this Particular App was the which really helped me out – SoundAbout.



You just need to install the App from Appstore and choose what you have to enable what you don’t.Do take special care while doing this and you can change whenever you want.


Voila!!You are done.Things are going smooth and till I Post this Blog Post.


Drawback

You have to select each operation for each function(Headset for music,Earpiece for Calling etc..) till you get a proper update from Sony. Since Sony Mobiles have stoppped their support for this model , I think we have to go with this patchwork.

item.title: Importance of Personal Domains and Branding – Quick Guide
item.description:
Who are you ?
Personal Domains play a vital role in Personal Branding. They gives a boost to the marketing and branding sector. Many of us would already be knowing it. For those who don't, Its time to rethink.

When we observe  the trends in the blogosphere,we see that giving your blog your name as domain name increases the popularity and helps in Personal branding. Its easy to remember names rather than boring blog titles.

People can fill them with their random blog posts and sometimes they can be even used as an online portfolio .By doing so you present yourself as a brand to the people out there.
 
Many Pros often do keep separate blogs , so as to differentiate themselves from the others. Like John Saddington's john.do ,chris coyier's chriscoyier.com , Amit Agarwal's amitagarwal.com .. and the list goes on.
 

Why should I do it ? What happens if I don't ?

Its simple. You don't lose anything. But you may lose the chance to brand yourself as some Pro’s do. The trends are changing and people are nowadays just exchanging their domain names instead of their business cards .
Stand Out !!.Narrow your Chances.

You lose all the Advantages listed below.
  • Standing Out from the Crowd.It helps you to show people how different and cool you are and as I mentioned above, it comes handy during business conversations.
  • Its the same Always . Whenever the trend changes you don't have to change your domain name as your domain name stays same as long as your name stays.
  • Gives an Idea and Unique Identity about you in the Web. As I mentioned above, uniqueness is the key factor that differentiates ourselves from others
  • Personal Email and other personal sub-domains. You get a bulk of of sub domains and email id’s (as per your hosting provider’s conditions). Having a separate email id and subdomains under our name is always cool !
  • Vulnerability to loose Domain in your name. Yeah that's Right. More than 398Kbabies are born per day (roughly) and who knows they don't have your name.

Things to Keep in Mind Before Choosing Personal Domains


  1. Be Original. Show that its you. Never try to replicate others’ ideas and stuff’s saying that its your own.you must posses some ethics and values .Always you be obliged to it.
  2. Go for .com and .me then others.
     People find it easier to say .com automatically and its the most common one too. If you cant get the right .com domain name ,go for other Top Level Domain names (TLD’s) like .me,.net etc .
  3. Simple and clean.Avoid unwanted punctuations and silly words in between .Keep it neat ,simple and easy to spell.
  4. Not too long. Longer Domain names can be annoying as its not easy to read or figure your name from it.
    (Your First Name)+(Your Middlename )+ (Your Last Name).com would make it unique. But Never do this. Always go for (Your First Name).com or (Your Last Name).com or at certain extend (Your First Name)+(Your Last Name).com  not (Your First Name)+(Your Middlename )+ (Your Last Name).com

Few Tools to Automate Your Domain Name Generation Process


Here is the list of few tools to generate random domain names with the given Keywords
  1. Domainr (My Favourite one)
  2. Bust A Name
  3. Lean Domain Search
  4. Name Mesh
  5. Domize

item.title: About Distraction Free Blog Editors
item.description:
Blogging has always been a hobby, moreover a passion, for me. This passion kept growing from time to time and finally I have reached here.

Distractions!!!!!!!

Blogging with a clear head and mind is always essential to get most out of you. Everyone don't have the talent to write by birth. I am one among them. That doesn't mean that those people should not write. Instead they should focus more and more on their weaknesses.


Main Cause – Distraction


Getting distracted while writing is very common. But avoiding it is the hard task.You cannot always get rid of it.So its better to avoid such situations.

Sometimes the Blog editor also play such a role in distracting you. Here comes the importance of the neat and clean yet powerful blog editor.

Finding a way..


I read many blogs talking about these issues and writers block that they experience due to it. All of them pointed towards many tools. But most of them had their hands towards the John Saddington's  Desk App.

Desk App with Multiple Platform Integration.

I searched for it in detailed and found the sad part that it was only available for Mac OS X.

It had all the cool features for a distraction free ambience for bloggers. It has got all the features needed but is not clumsy as other blog editors.It has got multiple platform integration and you can post even to Evernote

Its simple user friendly interface has gathered a lot of attention. It even helped them to become the best App award twice in a row.


But How is that Gonna Help Me???


I am a Windows user and I cant use it :( .

After a long search ,a very long one indeed, i found an alternative solution.
I was a regular user of windows live writer ,now Open Live writer . But these apps have its own kind of distraction to offer.

Recently I came to notice that Hemingway Editor also has a similar, clean and neat interface . Actually this Hemingway editor is for polishing your writing and is not for blogging. This tool is for showing the readability and user friendliness. Its available both as a Web App and Desktop Application (Paid).

This App is Surely Distraction Free

After seeing its UI , I right away installed Desktop App on my PC.

Found my "Windows User" Solution


By Now you may have already got what I did...

Hemmingway App + Open Live Writer = Voila !!

Yeah, I used Hemmingway app to draft my post and OLW to publish it after modification.
So it helped me to boost my posts' readability and provided me with clutter free experience.

Final Thoughts


Hoping that Desk brings us the windows version soon . Even Hemmingway App having integration with various platforms can be helpful.

Got any other tools in your list? Feel free to share it in the comments below.
Happy Blogging :) .

item.title: Install ,Update and Uninstall programs using "Chocolatey"
item.description:
Chocolatey is a simple automated software management tool which can be controlled by command lines in Windows.

I found it very useful and thought to share it.If you want to know more about it ,please go to their website.

I will be directly jumping to tutorials now.

Installing chocolatey(Recommended method)


Always "Run as Adminidtrator"


  • Open  cmd.exe (here i will be using Command prompt)
    P.S :Always run this as administrator as it requires permissions to install softwares

Installing Chocolatey using cmd.exe

  • Run the below code

@powershell -NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -Command "iex ((new-object net.webclient).DownloadString('https://chocolatey.org/install.ps1'))" && SET PATH=%PATH%;%ALLUSERSPROFILE%\chocolatey\bin

  • For Windows Powershell Users ,run th below code

iex ((new-object net.webclient).DownloadString('https://chocolatey.org/install.ps1'))

Success!!

 Installing , Uninstalling and Upgrading Softwares

We can install,uninstall and upgrade softwares very easily with chocolatey short command lines

  • For installing any program Your command goes like this
    choco install <your program>
  • For Uninstalling any program Your command goes like this
    choco uninstall <your program>
  • For Upgrading any program Your command goes like this
    choco upgrade <your program>

Example:  Installing Skype Using Chocolatey

our command to install skype is

item.title: 5 Practical tips to Reduce Your Website’s Bounce Rate
item.description:
Bounce rates are often considered as one of the key point in determining your website’s/blogs ranking. In simple words, Bounce rate tells you how much time people spend on your website. Less Bounce rate means people leaving your website less.

Obviously a great amount of work is required to bring back your readers to your circle.More readers always means more conversion. 

Here are few tips to help you to reduce your sites bounce rate based upon my experience.

#1. Landing page with Better User (Oriented) Experience –UX/UI

Your landing page matters the most.

Yes you heard it right. Over the past few years it has been a trend that the content quality is not the only factor that determines the ranking and design also matters.

Investing in good design not only gains the attention but its also proven that it increases conversion rates.Many people face it difficult to choose a perfect design and always need a tailor made designs.

For that case i suggest you to hire good Designers and the cost you spend on it is never a waste.These agencies nowadays also helps in your User Interface tweaks and gives User (Centric) analysis .

And as always Good design gets good attention. And Google want you to serve people not bots !

#2. Promising (not Killer) Call to Action

If You want to convert your readers into loyal readers and again loyal readers into your customers. Then you have to do this call to action. You have to give them an offer or service and make it so compelling that it leads to sales.

Promising Call to Action should serve its purpose and should not be a fraud ,as it will adversely affect your blog’s /Websites traffic.
Killer Call to Action Banners or Buttons can be compelling.But do think twice.Can you deliver them always those killer content always? If your answer is a No ,please keep it simple and accurate .So your readers wont be disappointed.

#3. Load it Faster (with no or less pop ups)



Good Design with faster content delivery also is a must. And Search engines prefer Responsive Websites.  Reduce the loading time considerably by avoiding unnecessary  bulky image files ,java scripts etc. 

Always try to build websites that use minimum amount of data. Because data usage can also be a deciding factor.

Avoid Using POP-UPs .Although those can help us to get quick attention from our readers.It can also  lead to increased bounce rates.So I strongly recommend to avoid using POP-UPs as they are really annoying. 

P.S. Many of our readers pointed out that giant blogging websites use them to advertise or as their Call to Action Banners.Yes ,you said it .
Its because their site/blog has got huge readership and  they already have their trusts.So there is less to worry about.

#4. Choose Your Keywords Accurately 

Proper keyword research is a must before you do the above steps.You should have detailed idea about your topic/niche and the group of readers you target.
Narrowing your target helps you to serve them with right dish with right recipe.

Most of the people thimk that injecting money making keywords into their site gives them good rankings.

Its Absolutely Wrong !!

Keywords with relevance scores here.When you consider top blogs and their keywords used,they always gave importance to most suiting and relevant keywords rather than choosing a pile of high traffic keywords.

Always keep in mind "Low Traffic Relevant Keywords Gives you more than high Traffic Irrelevant ones". 

#5. Offer them a reason to come back

If you want your readers to come back and visit your site again offer them perfect reason for it.

Quality !!!.

Yeah. I'm (super) stressing on this point again and again.By this time you must have understood about what I'm trying to say.

Tell your story in a completely different manner and standout from your fellow competitors. And always give them the reason for this question-

"Why should i come Back?"  

Bonus Tip - Get most out your 404 page



Always design your 404 pages with atmost care. Whenever an error occurs we don't want our users to leave .

Give them options like
  • search box 
  • recent posts
  • navigation links
  • popular posts ..etc
I suggest you not to put Ads in this page (But you can put links if you want).

Never allow them to get bored or get tired of  seeing your website/blog with some stupid  Ad based or Ads posts.Always serve them with right and relevant topics rather than serving them Ads.

Hope you got an idea to about how to pull back your bouncing customers and make them your loyal readers.Got any more ideas.Please do comment in the comment box below. Happy blogging

item.title: How Javascript Libraries like Jquery can Slow Down Your Blogs/Websites
item.description:
Avoid Jquery Smooth Running of Your Site !!

Everybody ,including me,uses Javascript libraries (like Jquery) in their Blogs.These Libraries do enhance the User Experience and reduces the amount of work required for plug-ins as these libraries acts as the back bone for them.


Well to be Javascript libraries are those collection of pre-coded to perform certain function.There are many other libraries like Prototype,MooTools, Ext Core, JsPHP etc  the most commonly used library is,as you all know, Jquery. 

But with the Pros they offer they also have Cons.

That is ,in simple words,when you load these libraries they load a large file which contain codes which your blog needs at that time.Plus it also loads Extra Junk files with them which may not be used by your blog.

As their name suggests,they are libraries ,the place from which you can borrow code for smooth running of your blog.

According to GiftofSpeed  these types of libraries have 95% unused codes.

I need them.I cant avoid it.

When you are in such a dilemma you can go for the smaller versions.That is, Jquery offers both full and minified versions.So just try with minified version,

If you are lucky enough you wont have any trouble in loading your blog.Your blog will load without any clutter.
You can use following simple tips to load your javascripts with less effort.

  • Always place Javascript Snippets at bottom. i.e. Just before </body> tag
  • In places where you want Jquery library at the top(for Example ,in some lazy load plugins).Always load javascriptsasynchronously. just add async to the code<script async src="example.js"></script>
Cross-posted from : GiftofSpeed

item.title: Basic Schema.org Markup for Blogger - Quick Tip
item.description:
Hello Everyone !!
In this short post we will be showing How to add Schema.Org Mark up to your Blogger blogs with ease.

What is Schema?

Its a kind of micro data that is used by Search Engines to get or interpret the details that is present in a particular website or blog more effectively.

How to Use it?

Note :There are many guides regarding the Schema.org micro data. Therefore we wont be dealing with it .If you want such guides please find it in the resources part.
We are skipping to implementation part directly .

How to Add it to blogger ?

For Post Titles

Find  <data:post.title/> and replace it with


<div itemprop='name headline'>


<data:post.title/>


</div>

For Post Body

Find  <data:post.body/> and replace it with

<div itemprop='articleBody'>

<data:post.body/>
</div>

General Cases 

In this code snippet we will cover

  1. Blog Title
  2. Post Image
  3. Author
  4. Description
<!-- Schema Mark Up by @franklinrockz -->
<b:if cond='data:blog.pageType == "item"'>

 <meta content='article' itemtype='http://schema.org/BlogPosting'/>

  <meta expr:content='data:blog.title' itemprop='name'/> 
  <b:if cond='data:blog.postImageThumbnailUrl'>
    <meta expr:content='data:blog.postImageThumbnailUrl' itemprop='image'/>
  </b:if>
<b:else/> 

</b:if>
<b:if cond='data:blog.url != data:blog.homepageUrl'>
<b:if cond='data:blog.pageType != "item"'>
<b:if cond='data:blog.metaDescription != ""'>
  <meta expr:content='data:blog.metaDescription' itemprop='description'/>
</b:if>
</b:if>
</b:if>
<meta expr:content='data:blog.canonicalUrl' itemprop='url'/>

<!-- Schema Mark Up -->

Voila !! We are done.

Now it time to Check 



Test your Blog using Google Rich Snippet Tool .

item.description:
Windows phone had created a boom in the whole world with its awesome metro style.It was a revolutionary move int the segment which shook the world around.Now each and every Designer is minimalist as seen in the windows Phones.

The default browser used ,the IE ,is not as flexible as its other companions . As always IE is far behind in the battle.

There was a bug reported on the responsive design and IE compatibility on the windows phone(384px x 640px)(which according to Microsoft officials,would be corrected soon).And many fixes could be found on the Internet .So I decided to bloggerrise the fix so all of you could use them .

Lets Begin

Step 0  Back up your template (Its very Important !!!). 

Step 1  Got Blogger >> Your Blog >> Template >> Edit HTML 

Step 2  Find <head> and Paste the Code Below.

CSS Part   
<style> 
@-webkit-viewport   { width: device-width; }
@-moz-viewport      { width: device-width; }
@-ms-viewport       { width: device-width; }
@-o-viewport        { width: device-width; }
@viewport           { width: device-width; }
 </style>

Javascript  
<script type='text/javascript'>//<![CDATA[
//Fix Windows phone Bug in Blogger
if (navigator.userAgent.match(/IEMobile\/10\.0/))
//Matching Version
 {
  var msViewportStyle = document.createElement("style");
  msViewportStyle.appendChild(
    document.createTextNode(
      "@-ms-viewport{width:auto!important}"
    )
  );
//View port Width set as Device width  document.getElementsByTagName("head")[0].
    appendChild(msViewportStyle);
}
//End of Fix Windows phone Bug in Blogger .tnx 2 @andreasnorman and
//]]></script>
Step 2   Save Template And You are done!!!

item.title: Speed up your Blogger Blogs with Custom fonts
item.description:
Adding Custom fonts to your blogs and sites have become a trend nowadays.I had already written about adding custom fonts to blogger earlier and it had recieved pretty good hits.Everyone(including me)was consious about the the time lag created by the custom fonts .As you know almost all the browsers (eg IE,chrome ) will not load anything until your custom font is loaded.That creates a huge time lag.
Today we will be dealing with this problem and fighting this .
Here we will be using Jquery script which was made by Omar AL Zabir (@omaralzabir) and edited by me for using it in blogger.

The main objective of this script is it pre caches the  font-file based on browser version and loads them before loading the CSS file.And with the help of Jquery we immediately loads the font file and thus it gets cached down there in the local disk and wont be loaded again.

Getting it done

Things to do before using this script (Read them here on my another post)
Create CSS file for font
Choose or Create Web Based fonts

Using the Script 

Find the </head> and paste the below code snippet above it.



/*Pre Caching font file script for Blogger inspired from Omar AL Zabir (@omaralzabir) */
var fontFilelink = jQuery.browser.msie ? 'url_of_Your_Font.eot'
    : 'url_of_Your_Font.otf'; /*Checking whether it is IE loads font for it*/
var cssFilelink = jQuery.browser.msie ? 'For_IE_url_of_Your_Font.css'
    : 'Not_IE_url_of_Your_Font.css';/*Checking whether it is IE loads CSS for it*/
 /*Begining the Jquery function*/
jQuery(document).ready(function(){
    jQuery.ajax({
    /*Font file Jquery function*/
      url: fontFilelink,
      beforeSend: function ( xhr ) {
        xhr.overrideMimeType("application/octet-stream");
      }
    }).done(function (data) {
        jQuery("    <link>")
          .appendTo(jQuery('head'))/*Appends to <head> tag*/
          .attr({type : 'text/css', rel : 'stylesheet'})
          .attr('href', cssFilelink);
    });});
Now Replace
  • Url_of_Your_Font.eot with your fonts .EOT file
  • Url_of_Your_Font.otf  with your fonts .OTF file
  • For_IE_url_of_Your_Font.css with your CSS for IE
  • Not_IE_url_of_Your_Font.css  with your CSS for other browsers


Remove the first line if you have already included jquery in your template.
Save your template

Thats all you are now set to rock your page

item.title: CSS & JS Auto Refreshing with Live.js WordPress Plugin
item.description:
Today I would like to share a fantastic tool that I had come across lately; The Live.js,plugin created by Martin Kool.
The main function of this JScript file is that it automatically clears and checks for changes in your current CSS and JavaScript files that you are working on , and refreshes them as soon as you finish editing it.
In short , you can open a text editor in one half  and your site in web browser in the other half of the screen. When you save changes in the editor, the updates are reflected immediately in your browser. It really helps to speed up your development time. 


Known Bugs 
A lot of editors offer us live HTML preview, but the major drawback is that they work only  for simple .html page.Here is what is great about Live.js , it works on any kind of webpage, which includes a working WP theme.

Live.js for WordPress Plugin
Here this Idea for Live.js WP Plugin was put forward by noupe.com and all credits goes to them !!

They have combined a  plugin for WP to make it all easy. Here is how you’re gonna unlock this magical tool . 
1.      Download plugin from here

3.      Make sure that you are signed in and working locally.And Live.js will be automatically added to your current theme.

Always Remember-Never use this script on a live site as it can make it faulty .It is also adviced to keep an Uptodate Back Up.There is no need to upload this plugin to server with other essential files as it is purely made for developmental process.

item.title: How to Upload and Use Custom Fonts with @font-face on Blogger
item.description:
Adding Custom Fonts for Blogger
Custom fonts are vastly available which can be added to a site to make it more unique .There are numerous methods to embed fonts to a blog/ website ,from which several of them are paid services like Typekit & Google Webfonts.With the help of CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) you can easily add custom font to your blog/website.This is made possible with @font-face expression.


Today we will be going through different Typography(font styling) and How to implement those on your blogger blogs.

Things to Know Before You Start

First of all lets go through the different types of fonts that are widely used today.They are as follows
    TTF For almost all browsers except Internet Explorer and iPhone Browser
    EOT For Internet Explorer only
    SVG For Apple Products like  iPhone/iPod/iPad.
    WOFF Normally Compressed type ,for emerging standards
By Embedding fonts in these formats would make your custom font visible clearly without the Flash of Unstyled Text(FOUT) issue.FOUT issue happens when our fonts are not cross browser compatible or even happens when the users Internet connection is too slow.Don't worry too much about it now as we will be solving this problem later in this post .

Do you haveFOUT Isuue ??

Why to Use Your own Custom Fonts in Blogger

Note : If You are using Wordpress Blogs Read This Tutorial by Matt Russell.

We Know that Blogger Provides Custom fonts in the Template Designer,but those are default fonts(Yes Of course it is beautiful )and all who use Blogger can add it too.So to make our Blog bit more unique we need a different style of Typography for your blogger blog .This will take your blog to a step higher.

Lets Begin

This tutorial will be a bit long as we are going through almost all steps in detailed.So grab a cup of coffee and start reading this stuff and be prepared to rock your Blog !!!

Before we begin take a look at the Screenshot below .This one is taken before I applied the Custom Font (Too boring !!!).We will be redesigning it to make it more Unique and Stylish.
Really Awkward Isn' it ???

Step 0. Backup Your Template
It is very important to back up your template .This would help you to Undo changes even if anything goes wrong.
Step 1. Select or Download A Font From The Collection 

This step (Selecting  Fonts )must be taken with due Care as fonts can be copyright protected.Please do check twice whether they are having commercial / Personal licences.Normally Commercial licenses are a must to use those fonts in your Blogs.

Here are some links where you can find hundreds of fonts.
  • Dafont
  • Fontsquirrel
  • Urbanfonts
Download it .Most probably it will be in OTF or in TTF format.

Step 2. Convert The Downloaded Font to @Font-Face Kit
Convert & Download Your Font Kit
As we know the main step is to convert the downloaded fonts to different formats with @font-face kit.You just need to upload it to one of the following services and which they will convert it into different formats.After conversion you can download the kit.
  • Fontsquirrels(Recommended)
  • Font2web
Note that the kit will contain 4 formats of fonts(inside the fonts folder) , a CSS stylesheet & an index.html file.


Step 3. Upload fonts to the server / Dropbox 
Upload the fonts to Server
In this step we will be uploading the fonts (4 formats) to server.It is necessary to upload to a server or else others wont have access to view it.Since we are using Blogger we do not have access to Google Servers .So we need to upload it your own server(or cloud services).I prefer  Dropbox as it is more reliable and User friendly.(Of course you can use other services too ,But remember that we need the public link with extension ,say your_font.ttf which you can easily obtain from dropbox)

If you are going to use Dropbox, just upload it to Public folder(Link) .You need to copy the Public URL's of all 4 fonts and copy it to a place ,say a notepad file as we need it in our next step .


Step 4. Edit Source Location -
You  need to Change URL of all 4 fonts (Click to Enlarge )

You need to alter all the Source location Url  in the CSS  to the location where you have uploaded it.You need to edit the .woff,.ttf,.svg &.otf source location with your Public Links.

Step 5.Add that Edited CSS Code to Blogger template 

You can add that CSS code by going to the Blogger->Template->Edit Html and Add CSS Code just above ]]></b:skin> and Save it.

 Step 6. Declare the Custom Font using CSS -

In this part you want to apply the Fonts to wherever you want .Most preferred places many people use custom fonts are in the titles and post body .

Post Title - For Using these font in Post Title  Edit  your_font name with your custom font name  and   Add the edited CSS Code just above ]]></b:skin> and Save it.
.post-title {
 font-family: Your_font; /* no need of Exensions like .svg , .ttf ,.otf */
}
Post Body - For Using these font in Post Body Edit your_font name with your custom font name and  Add the edited CSS Code just above ]]></b:skin> and Save it.
.post-body,.post {
 font-family: Your_font; /* no need of Exensions like .svg , .ttf ,.otf */
}
Step 7. Define Back-Up Fonts (Optional but Recommended to avoid FOUT) 

We create a simple back up for Your custom with other fonts so that even if one has slow connection and if the font doesn't load ,He/ She can see the Back up of the fonts.

It is very Easy to add.You just need to extend your font-family declaration with some fonts and comas..You can see the example here.

Post Title
.post-title {
font-family: 'Your_font',Verdana,sans-serif; /* Here also Verdana,sans-serif are added as Back up */
}
Post Body
.post-body,.post {
font-family: 'Your_font',Verdana,sans-serif; /* Here Verdana,sans-serif are added as Back up */
}
Step 8.Check your Website
Wow !! It changed my blog entirely ...


That's All !! You are done .
Just Preview Your Blog before saving and if it works Save it or else double check the codes ,Url's etc .Even if it again goes wrong feel free to comment your query

  • Fighting FOUT with Paul Irish
I hope this tutorial helped you a lot .Do you have any other methods for adding custom fonts ? Let us know that tip.Post it in the comments.

Happy Blogging Pals !! May God Bless you.

item.title: Make Your All Images Responsive with a JQuery Plugin
item.description:
Update - We have reverted back into a BlogSpot domain due to some technical issues.
It Has been a responsive web design revolution where every kind of stuff from text to videos are easily accessible without maintaining  different mobile themes.One of the important one is - Responsive Images Using Commands .That is,Their job is to serve the right image for the occasion.There are many techniques used for responsive images now . We will be going through them in brief and we will learn how to implement these.



Many Ways, But not a Complete Solution

There are many ways to do this. Usual way is by defining the  size and separate location / src  from your server.
<img src="200x100.png" data-1x="400x200.jpg" data-2x="800x400.jpg">
We know It is not at all possible to go back to all the posts or pages and add the data attribute and re-upload different images them when there are lots of posts and pages .This created the need for plug-ins which make the work easier.

Then Sencha.IO  was introduced ,but it too requires the prefixing for the required width or height.
<img src='http://src.sencha.io/320/200/http://domain.com/img/u.png'>
This also was not a complete solution .Even the Photos hosted in  Picasa needed prefixes.
<img src=http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-1iYBZqQq9RM/UVw5txMeIxI/AAAAAAAABjY/WvGn2iKRrvI/s320/alexa-ranking.jpg">
Here we need to Change s320 with other prefixes for resizing .Read more about it by Harish here.

Better Solution : Responsive img Jquery Plug-in

Responsive Img Plugin
By going through many of the plug-ins around the web , the most easiest to use plug-in I found was Responsive img JQuery plug-in.This plug-in resizes the Image according to the device display scale and resizes accordingly.Of course there are many plug-ins out there in the town.  
Apart from others the highlight is that these images gets saved in your servers.Once these images are saved the plug-in delivers from the servers automatically and it is not needed to be created again.

Adding this Plug-in to your site

It is also very easy as 1 2 3 to implement. Just follow these steps.
# Step 0 - Always take backup of your site before you start playing with it.
# Step 1 - Make sure that you have added the Jquery  Plugin to your </head> .If not add it 
<script src='//ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/1.9.1/jquery.min.js'></script>
# Step 2 - Download the file and
# Step 3 - Upload it your server and find its URL / location .
# Step 4 - Add the following code above </head> and replace the URL with yours (which you got in # Step 3)
<script async='async' src='your-domain.com/files/js/responsiveImg.js'></script>
Don't worry to add it to the header section as it will not obstruct the other elements as it will be downloaded parallelaly with help of async='async'   (And the file is pretty small too !! )
# Step 5 - Include the following line of JavaScript in your Website (preferably above </head>)
<script> $("img").responsiveImg();</script>
You are done !!!

Possible for Wordpress ,but not Blogger 

Yes this is the sad part of it .Since wordpress blogs are hosted  in servers , this will work with wordpress.But the Blogger users like me can't use it because  the blogger blogs are hosted in Google servers and the Images are hosted in another server(picasa's Server) and we do not have the rights to access it.
But Dont worry there is an alternative
With help of this CSS Snippet your images will be resized according to the need.
Go to templates -> Edit Html ->Add these below Codes above  ]]</b:skin> and Save it 
img{
max-width: 100%; 
height: auto;
}
Well the above one is not a good solution as it will load the entire image before resizing which will increase your site load time.

  • For More Customization and Details  - Go here
  • Similar Plug - in/ Project by Matt Wilcox - adaptive images
  • Here is the complete  list of Methods  like this  by Christopher Schmitt and Chris Coyiers'  to Make Your All Images Responsive that we had mentioned earlier.

item.title: Externally Hosting Your CSS Files Using Dropbox
item.description:
Dropbox is a wonderful online cloud service which helps you to store your data files on their servers.For Basic users (free users )they gives space up to 18 GB (2 GB+ referral space)and for Paid plans even more.Its so easy to use ,either you can install their software or you can use it online.
Today we are going to learn how to host CSS files using Dropbox
. But Before that ..

Why Dropbox is preferred to host CSS externally

Update : its no longer preferable

Even though many services like Google code offers free service and it can be used to render JavaScript files.But in case of CSS ,it is not a better idea as the file is not delivered accurately.And we need it(CSS) to be delivered badly as it affects our whole design of our blog. Apart from Google code ,the best reliable service is offered by Dropbox.Thus we use it :)

And the most important reason is ,as per browserdiet it helps in browser caching which will increase* the speed of your website.We checked its loading time and found that it may take few milliseconds more during the page load ,But you can rely on it .

*Note - It works only if the user has enabled Cache in his/her browser
Test your blog using Pingdom tools

Advantages of Hosting CSS files in Dropbox

  • 99% Server Uptime
  • Good file Delivery system
  • Good for less traffic Blogs

Disadvantages of Hosting CSS files in Dropbox

  • Of course Dropbox has certain bandwidth limit. As per Dropbox support, it is 20GB/day for Free(Basic) accounts and 200GB/day for Paid (Pro and Teams) . Links which uses more bandwidth will be disabled
  • Lack in Delivery Speed due to more traffic

Hosting Your Blogger CSS Using Dropbox

  1. Go to Template -> Edit Html 
  2. Find all the CSS in between <b:skin><![CDATA[  and  ]]></b:skin>
  3. Cut and Paste it new notepad file and Save it .
  4. Rename it to Anyfilename.css
  5. Go to Dropbox
  6. Upload  it dropbox 's Public folder
  7. Copy the public link
  8. Now paste the following code before </head> 
    9. <link href='YOUR PUBLIC LINK' rel='stylesheet'/>
  9. Change YOUR PUBLIC LINK to your link.
  10. Save your template.You are done !!
Hope you liked our post .Please do share it .Comment if there is any query and suggestions.
